Class Employee

java.lang.Object
Employee
public class Employee extends Object
The Employee class represents an employee with various attributes like name, job category, job role, pay scale, and salary details. It also provides functionality for promoting an employee to a higher job role within their category.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Employee.JobCategory
    Enum to store job categories and their associated job types.
    static enum 
    Employee.JobType
    Enum representing all job roles (JobTypes) across different categories.

  • Constructor Details

    • Employee

      public Employee(String name, String PPSno, Employee.JobCategory jobCategory, Employee.JobType jobRole, int payScale)
      Constructor for creating an Employee object.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the employee.
      PPSno - The PPS number of the employee.
      jobCategory - The category of the job the employee holds.
      jobRole - The specific role the employee holds in the job category.
      payScale - The pay scale assigned to the employee.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the jobRole is invalid for the given jobCategory.

    • Employee

      public Employee(String name, String PPSno, Employee.JobCategory jobCategory, Employee.JobType jobRole, int payScale, String userType)
      Constructor for creating an Employee object.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the employee.
      PPSno - The PPS number of the employee.
      jobCategory - The category of the job the employee holds.
      jobRole - The specific role the employee holds in the job category.
      payScale - The pay scale assigned to the employee.
      userType - The user type of the user. Used in CLI
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the jobRole is invalid for the given jobCategory.

    • Employee

      public Employee(String name, String PPSno, Employee.JobCategory jobCategory, Employee.JobType jobRole, int payScale, String userType, String promotion)

  • Method Details

    • promotion

      public void promotion(String newRole)
      Promotes the given employee to a higher job role within their category. If the current job role is the highest in the category, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      newRole - The employee to be promoted.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the job role is already at the highest in the category.

    • acceptPromotion

      public void acceptPromotion()
      Accepts promotion for an employee and updates details in "Employees.csv" It finds the row by PPS number and updates promotion status.

    • rejectPromotion

      public void rejectPromotion()
      rejects promotion for an employee and updates details in "Employees.csv" It finds the row by PPS number and sets the promotion status to "null".

    • isRoleValidForCategory

      public boolean isRoleValidForCategory(Employee.JobCategory jobCategory, Employee.JobType jobRole)
      Checks if the job role is valid for the given job category.
      Parameters:
      jobCategory - The job category.
      jobRole - The job role.
      Returns:
      True if the job role is valid for the category, false otherwise.
